section.name: s1
section.heading: Citation
section.content: These regulations may be cited as the Road Traffic (Driving Licences) Regulations.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In these regulations, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: 1949 Convention (1949年國際公約) means the International Convention relative to the international circulation of motor traffic concluded at Geneva on 19 September 1949; (L.N. 49 of 2007)

applicant (申請人) means a person who has applied for a driving licence, driving test, motor cycle driving test, driving instructor’s licence or permit under these regulations, as the case may be, or for reissue or renewal of a driving licence or driving instructor’s licence; (L.N. 273 of 1989; 23 of 2008 s. 23)
articulated vehicle (掛接式車輛) has the meaning assigned to it by regulation 2 of the Road Traffic (Construction and Maintenance of Vehicles) Regulations (Cap. 374 sub. leg. A);
authorized examiner (經授權考牌主任) means a person appointed under regulation 29(1) to be an authorized examiner for the purpose of conducting driving tests;
authorized trainer (經授權導師) means a person authorized under regulation 29A to be a trainer; (L.N. 154 of 2021)

class (種類), when used in relation to a motor vehicle in connexion with any matter relating to a driving licence, driving test, driving instructor’s licence or permit, means a class of motor vehicle specified in regulation 5;
designated group (指定組別) means group 1, group 2 or group 3 within the meaning of regulation 20A; (L.N. 154 of 2021)
driving instructor (駕駛教師) means a person who is the holder of a valid driving instructor’s licence;
driving instructor’s test (駕駛教師的測驗) means a test referred to in regulation 24;
driving test (駕駛測驗) means a test of competence to drive a motor vehicle (other than a motor cycle and a motor tricycle) conducted in accordance with regulations 32 and 33; (L.N. 273 of 1989)

full driving licence (正式駕駛執照) means a driving licence other than a learner’s driving licence, temporary driving licence, probationary driving licence or a driving licence to drive Government vehicles; (49 of 2000 s. 3)
Government vehicle (政府車輛) means a vehicle owned by the Government;
group (組別), in relation to a driving instructor’s licence, means a group of motor vehicles specified in regulation 20A; (L.N. 161 of 2000)
identity card (身分證) has the meaning assigned to it by section 1A of the Registration of Persons Ordinance (Cap. 177); (L.N. 3 of 2008)
identity document (身分證明文件) has the meaning assigned to it by regulation 2 of the Road Traffic (Registration and Licensing of Vehicles) Regulations (Cap. 374 sub. leg. E);

def.name: InternationalDrivingPermit
def.leadIn: international driving permit (國際駕駛許可證) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an international driving permit in Form 1 of the Ninth Schedule issued under the authority of a country or place which is a party to the 1949 Convention; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an international driving permit issued under regulation 36; (L.N. 49 of 2007)

section.def: learner driver (學習駕駛人士) means a person who is the holder of a valid learner’s driving licence;
licence holder (執照持有人) means a person to whom a driving licence or driving instructor’s licence has been issued under these regulations so long as such licence remains in force;
motor cycle driving test (電單車駕駛測驗) means a test of competence to drive a motor cycle or a motor tricycle conducted in accordance with regulation 12C; (L.N. 273 of 1989)
permanent identity card (永久性居民身分證) has the meaning assigned to it by section 1A of the Registration of Persons Ordinance (Cap. 177); (L.N. 3 of 2008)
private driving instructor (私人駕駛教師) means a driving instructor whose driving instructor’s licence is not subject to a condition imposed under regulation 22(1A); (L.N. 97 of 2001)
private driving instructor identity plate (私人駕駛教師證) means a private driving instructor identity plate issued under regulation 27A(1); (L.N. 154 of 2021)
private driving instructor’s licence (私人駕駛教師執照) means the driving instructor’s licence of a private driving instructor; (L.N. 97 of 2001)

probationary driving period (暫准駕駛期), in relation to an application for a full driving licence, means the probationary driving period for the purpose of that application as provided in regulation 12F; (23 of 2008 s. 23)
relevant date (有關日期) means the date on which section 28 of the Road Traffic Legislation (Amendment) Ordinance 2008 (23 of 2008) comes into operation*; (23 of 2008 s. 23)

def.name: RelevantMotorVehicle
def.leadIn: relevant motor vehicle (有關汽車), in relation to a person who holds a probationary driving licence to drive a class of motor vehicle, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a motor vehicle of the class; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person holds a probationary driving licence to drive another class of motor vehicle and has not completed the probationary driving period for the purpose of his application for a full driving licence to drive that other class of motor vehicle, a motor vehicle of that other class; (23 of 2008 s. 23)

section.def: restricted driving instructor (受限制駕駛教師) means a driving instructor whose driving instructor’s licence is subject to a condition imposed under regulation 22(1A); (L.N. 97 of 2001)
rigid vehicle (整體式車輛) has the meaning assigned to it by regulation 2 of the Road Traffic (Construction and Maintenance of Vehicles) Regulations (Cap. 374 sub. leg. A);
visitor (到港人士) has the meaning assigned to it by regulation 2 of the Road Traffic (Registration and Licensing of Vehicles) Regulations (Cap. 374 sub. leg. E).

section.name: s3
section.heading: Exemptions
section.text: The Chief Secretary for Administration in his discretion may waive any of these regulations in respect of the driver of a motor vehicle which is the property of a government other than the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region temporarily brought into Hong Kong for the use of an accredited representative of such government.

subsection.content: Subject to paragraph (2), these regulations shall apply to persons in the public service of the State in the same manner as Parts 5, 7, 8 and 12 of the Ordinance are applied under section 3(1) of the Ordinance to persons in the public service of the State. (3 of 2002 s. 15; E.R. 2 of 2012)

subsection.leadIn: These regulations do not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any member of the Chinese People’s Liberation Army; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any person who is employed by the Chinese People’s Liberation Army,

subsection.continued: when he is driving a vehicle belonging to the Chinese People’s Liberation Army in the course of his duties. (2 of 2012 s. 3)

section.name: s5
section.heading: Classification of motor vehicles for issue of driving licences
section.leadIn: For the purpose of the issue of driving licences, motor vehicles shall be divided into the following classes— (L.N. 259 of 1984)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: private cars;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: taxis;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: public light buses and private light buses;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: public buses and private buses;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: light goods vehicles;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: medium goods vehicles;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: heavy goods vehicles;

paragraph.name: ga
h
paragraph.content: special purpose vehicles;

paragraph.name: i
ia
j
paragraph.content: invalid carriages;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: Government vehicles.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Restrictions on issue of driving licences

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting regulation 35, if— (35 of 2023 s. 59)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the person is disqualified to drive the class of motor vehicle,

subsection.continued: the Commissioner shall not issue, reissue or renew the driving licence to the person.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting regulation 35, if— (35 of 2023 s. 59)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person applies to the Commissioner under these regulations for the issue, reissue or renewal of a driving licence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person is ordered under section 72A(1)(b), (1A) or (9A) of the Ordinance, or is required under section 8AA(1) of or ordered under section 8AA(6) of the Road Traffic (Driving-offence Points) Ordinance (Cap. 375), to attend and complete a driving improvement course; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person has not complied with the order or requirement,

subsection.continued: the Commissioner shall not issue, reissue or renew the driving licence to the person.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person applies to the Commissioner under these regulations for the issue, reissue or renewal of a driving licence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a summons issued under section 8(2) of the Road Traffic (Driving-offence Points) Ordinance (Cap. 375) has been served on the person in accordance with section 14A of that Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person has failed to appear before a magistrate in answer to the summons,

subsection.continued: the Commissioner shall not issue, reissue or renew the driving licence to the person. (4 of 2009 s. 6)

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting regulation 35, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person applies to the Commissioner under these regulations for the issue, reissue or renewal of a driving licence to drive a taxi;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the person—

subparagraph.content: is ordered under section 72A(1)(b) or (9A) of the Ordinance; or
is required under section 20, or ordered under section 23(2), of the Taxi-Driver-Offence Points Ordinance (Cap. 647),

paragraph.continued: to attend and complete a taxi service improvement course; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person has not complied with the order or requirement,

subsection.continued: the Commissioner must not issue or reissue the driving licence to the person, or renew it. (35 of 2023 s. 59 and E.R. 5 of 2024)

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person applies to the Commissioner under these regulations for the issue, reissue or renewal of a driving licence to drive a taxi;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a summons issued under section 27(1) of the Taxi-Driver-Offence Points Ordinance (Cap. 647) has been served on the person in accordance with sections 28 and 29 of that Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person has failed to appear in answer to the summons,

subsection.continued: the Commissioner must not issue or reissue the driving licence to the person, or renew it. (35 of 2023 s. 59 and E.R. 5 of 2024)

subsection.leadIn: A driving licence entitling the holder thereof to drive—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a private car;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a light goods vehicle;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a motor cycle; (L.N. 273 of 1989)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a motor tricycle; or (L.N. 273 of 1989)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: an invalid carriage, (L.N. 273 of 1989)

subsection.continued: shall not be issued to a person under the age of 18 years.

subsection.content: A driving licence entitling the holder thereof to drive a motor vehicle of a class other than any class specified in paragraph (1) shall not be issued to a person under the age of 21 years.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to paragraph (4), a person shall not be eligible for a full driving licence to drive—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a taxi;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a public light bus or private light bus;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a public bus or private bus;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a medium goods vehicle;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a heavy goods vehicle; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a special purpose vehicle,

subsection.continued: unless, at the date of his application for such licence, the person satisfies the conditions set out in paragraph (1A). (23 of 2008 s. 25)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: The conditions referred to in paragraph (1) are that— (L.N. 1 of 2020)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is a holder of a valid full driving licence to drive a private car or light goods vehicle;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: subject to paragraph (1B)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the licence was issued to the person before the relevant date;

subparagraph.name: ii
iii
subparagraph.content: the licence was issued to the person pursuant to regulation 11(1AA)(c), (1AB)(c) or (d), (2), (3) or (3A) on or after the relevant date, and the person has held the licence for at least 1 year immediately preceding the application; and (L.N. 1 of 2020)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person has subsequently passed the appropriate driving test. (23 of 2008 s. 25)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: The Commissioner may, in relation to a person’s application for a full driving licence referred to in paragraph (1), exempt, in writing, the person from the condition set out in paragraph (1A)(b). (23 of 2008 s. 25)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to paragraph (4), a person shall not be eligible for a full driving licence to drive an articulated vehicle unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he is the holder of a valid full driving licence to drive a medium goods vehicle or heavy goods vehicle; and (L.N. 259 of 1984)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he has passed the appropriate driving test.

subsection.content: A person shall not be eligible for a full driving licence to drive a motor vehicle referred to in paragraph (1) or (2) if he has been convicted of an offence under section 36, 36A, 39, 39A, 39B, 39C, 39J, 39K, 39L, 39O(1) or 39S of the Ordinance during the 5 years immediately preceding his application. (24 of 2011 s. 21)
The Commissioner may in his discretion take into consideration driving experience gained other than under a driving licence issued in Hong Kong.

section.name: s8A
section.heading: Pre-service course for taxis, public light buses and public buses

subsection.content: This regulation applies to an applicant for the issue of a full driving licence to drive a taxi, public light bus or public bus under regulation 11(2C).

subsection.leadIn: Despite paragraph (1), this regulation does not apply to an applicant for a full driving licence to drive a taxi or public bus if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant falls within regulation 11(2CA)(a)(i) or (c)(i) and has applied before 1 October 2020 for the driving test relevant to the licence; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant falls within regulation 11(2CA)(a)(ii) or (c)(iii) and has applied before 1 October 2020 for the driving test that entitles the applicant to be issued with the licence under that regulation. (L.N. 1 of 2020)

subsection.content: An applicant to which this regulation applies is not eligible for a full driving licence to drive a taxi, public light bus or public bus unless the applicant has attended and completed a pre-service course in accordance with the code of practice within 1 year preceding the date of application.

For the purposes of paragraph (3), the date on which a person has attended and completed a pre-service course in accordance with the code of practice is the date of completion of the course as specified in the course certificate issued to the person.

If the Commissioner considers that an applicant need not complete any part of a pre-service course because the applicant’s previous experience is adequate for the purpose of that part, the Commissioner may exempt the applicant from that part. (L.N. 1 of 2020)

subsection.leadIn: In this regulation—
subsection.def: code of practice (《實務守則》) has the meaning given to it by section 102H of the Ordinance;
course certificate (課程證書) has the meaning given to it by section 102H of the Ordinance.

subsection.content: On application for a driving licence or reissue or renewal thereof, the applicant shall make a declaration in such form and in such manner as is specified by the Commissioner as to whether or not he is suffering from any disease or physical disability specified in the First Schedule, or any other disease or physical disability which would be liable to cause the driving by him of a motor vehicle of such class as he would be authorized to drive by the licence for which he is applying to be a source of danger to the public. (L.N. 3 of 2008; 23 of 2008 s. 26)

content.leadIn: If, from the declaration required by paragraph (1), it appears to the Commissioner that the applicant is suffering from any disease or physical disability referred to in paragraph (1), the Commissioner shall refuse to issue, reissue or renew the driving licence: (L.N. 3 of 2008; 23 of 2008 s. 26)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the applicant may, except in the case of any disease or physical disability specified in the First Schedule, claim to be subjected to a test specified by the Commissioner as to his fitness or ability to drive a motor vehicle of any such class as he would be authorized by the driving licence to drive, and if the applicant passes the test the driving licence shall not be refused by reason only of the declared disease or physical disability but may, if the test proves the applicant’s fitness to drive only a motor vehicle of a particular construction or design, be limited to the driving of a vehicle of such construction or design.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to paragraph (2), a holder of a valid driving licence who suffers from—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any disease or physical disability specified in the First Schedule; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any disease or physical disability—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: not being a disease or physical disability specified in the First Schedule; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: which is liable to cause the driving by him of a motor vehicle (being a motor vehicle of any such class as he is authorized by the driving licence to drive) to be a source of danger to the public,

subsection.continued: from which he did not suffer at the time when the issue, reissue or renewal (as the case may be) of the licence was applied for shall, after he becomes aware of such disease or disability, forthwith give notice in writing of such fact to the Commissioner. (L.N. 183 of 1997; 23 of 2008 s. 26)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.leadIn: Where a notice under paragraph (2A) is received by the Commissioner from a holder of a driving licence, the Commissioner may, if after making such inquiry as he considers necessary he is satisfied that there is reasonable ground to believe that the licence holder is suffering from any disease or disability referred to in paragraph (2A)(b)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cancel the driving licence and grant a driving licence limited to driving an invalid carriage to the licence holder if he is satisfied that the licence holder is fit to drive an invalid carriage; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: cancel the driving licence after giving to the licence holder written notice of his intention to do so. (L.N. 183 of 1997)

subsection.name: 2C
subsection.leadIn: A holder of a driving licence to whom a notice is given under paragraph (2B)(b) may claim to be subjected to a test as to his fitness or ability to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: drive a motor vehicle of a particular construction or design; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: drive a motor vehicle of any class he is authorized by the licence to drive provided he wears suitable spectacles or other corrective lenses, a hearing aid or other apparatus,

subsection.continued: and if he passes the test specified by the Commissioner the driving licence shall not be cancelled or, if it has already been cancelled, it shall be returned to the licence holder and the cancellation shall be rescinded. (L.N. 183 of 1997)

content.leadIn: If it appears to the Commissioner that there is reason to believe that any person who holds a driving licence is suffering from a disease or physical disability not specified in the First Schedule which is liable to cause the driving by him of a motor vehicle, being a motor vehicle of any such class as he is authorized by the driving licence to drive, to be a source of danger to the public, and after making such inquiry as he considers necessary the Commissioner is satisfied that the licence holder so suffering from such disease or physical disability has previously passed a test under this regulation, the Commissioner, after giving to the licence holder notice of his intention to cancel the driving licence, may cancel the driving licence: (L.N. 183 of 1997)

proviso.name: proviso
proviso.leadIn: Provided that a licence holder, except in the case of any disease or physical disability specified in the First Schedule, may claim to be subjected to a test as to his fitness or ability to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: drive a motor vehicle of a particular construction or design; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: drive a motor vehicle of any class he is authorized by the licence to drive provided he wears suitable spectacles or other corrective lenses, a hearing aid or other apparatus,

proviso.continued: and if he passes the test specified by the Commissioner the driving licence shall not be cancelled or, if it has already been cancelled, it shall be returned to the licence holder and the cancellation thereof shall be rescinded.

subsection.content: The Commissioner may impose on a driving licence the holder of which has been subjected to a test under paragraph (2C) or (3) a condition that the licence holder shall wear suitable spectacles or other corrective lenses, a hearing aid or other apparatus while driving, or may limit the driving licence to the driving of a motor vehicle of a particular construction or design. (L.N. 183 of 1997)

A licence holder whose driving licence is endorsed with a condition that he shall wear suitable spectacles or other corrective lenses, a hearing aid or other apparatus when driving shall not drive without wearing such spectacles or other corrective lenses, hearing aid or other apparatus.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner shall refuse to issue, reissue or renew a driving licence in the case of an applicant, who is 70 years of age or more, who— (23 of 2008 s. 26)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is not medically fit to drive and control a motor vehicle in the class to which his application relates; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not able to read a registration mark at a distance of 23 metres in good daylight (with the aid of spectacles or other corrective lenses, if worn).

subsection.content: A licence holder who has been given a notice in accordance with paragraph (3) shall, within 72 hours after receipt of such notice, surrender his driving licence to the Commissioner for cancellation.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Paragraphs (2A), (2B) and (2C) do not apply in relation to driving licences issued before the commencement* of the Road Traffic (Driving Licences) (Amendment) (No. 2) Regulation 1997 (L.N. 183 of 1997).

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: This paragraph shall cease to have effect at the end of the period of 3 years after the commencement of the Road Traffic (Driving Licences) (Amendment) (No. 2) Regulation 1997 (L.N. 183 of 1997). (L.N. 183 of 1997)

subsection.content: A person who wishes to obtain a full driving licence in respect of any class of motor vehicle shall deliver to the Commissioner an application therefor in a form specified by the Commissioner, signed by the applicant, together with his document of identity. (L.N. 192 of 1989; L.N. 3 of 2008)

subsection.leadIn: In addition to making a declaration required by regulation 9(1), the applicant shall state in his application under paragraph (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether he has held a driving licence issued in Hong Kong or a driving certificate or driving licence issued in any country or place other than Hong Kong; and if the applicant has held any such licence or certificate, he shall also state the class of motor vehicle which he was permitted to drive under such licence or certificate; (3 of 2002 s. 15)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether any such licence or certificate held previously has been endorsed, suspended or cancelled;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: whether under regulation 9(2), the Commissioner has at any time refused to issue or reissue him a driving licence or renew his driving licence; and (23 of 2008 s. 27)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: whether he is or has at any time been disqualified from holding or obtaining the driving licence for which he is applying.

subsection.leadIn: In the case of an applicant for a full driving licence to drive any class of motor vehicle, where the applicant is 70 years of age or more, his application under paragraph (1) shall be accompanied by a certificate by a registered medical practitioner who is acceptable to the Commissioner that on a date within 4 months before the application, the applicant is medically fit to drive and control any vehicle in that class and the Commissioner shall satisfy himself that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the medical fitness of the applicant has not deteriorated substantially since that date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant is able to read a registration mark at a distance of 23 metres in good daylight (with the aid of spectacles or other corrective lenses, if worn). (49 of 2000 s. 4)

def.name: DocumentOfIdentity
def.leadIn: In this regulation, document of identity (證明身分的文件), in relation to an applicant, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the applicant holds a permanent identity card, his permanent identity card;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where the applicant does not hold a permanent identity card—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: his identity card (other than a permanent identity card), if he has one; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: his valid travel document as defined in section 2(1) of the Immigration Ordinance (Cap. 115). (L.N. 3 of 2008)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: Subject to regulations 6, 7, 8 and 9, the Commissioner shall issue a full driving licence to drive a motor cycle or motor tricycle to an applicant if he has completed, within 3 years prior to the date of his application for the full driving licence, the probationary driving period for the purpose of the application. (23 of 2008 s. 28)

subsection.name: 1AA
subsection.leadIn: Subject to regulations 6, 7, 8 and 9, the Commissioner shall issue a full driving licence to drive a private car to an applicant if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he has completed, within 3 years prior to the date of his application for the full driving licence, the probationary driving period for the purpose of the application; or (L.N. 1 of 2020)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: he—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: has applied for a driving test in respect of private cars;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has been issued with a temporary driving licence to drive a private car pending the test; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: has passed, within 3 years prior to the date of his application for the full driving licence, the test. (23 of 2008 s. 28)

subsection.name: 1AB
subsection.leadIn: Subject to regulations 6, 7, 8 and 9, the Commissioner shall issue a full driving licence to drive a light goods vehicle to an applicant if—

paragraph.name: a
c
paragraph.leadIn: he—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: has applied for a driving test in respect of light goods vehicles;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has been issued with a temporary driving licence to drive a light goods vehicle pending the test; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: has passed, within 3 years prior to the date of his application for the full driving licence, the test; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: he—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is a holder of a valid full driving licence to drive a private car;

subparagraph.name: A
B
subparagraph.content: if the licence was issued to him pursuant to paragraph (1AA)(a), for at least 2 years immediately preceding his application for the full driving licence to drive a light goods vehicle; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: if the licence was issued to him pursuant to paragraph (1AA)(c), (2), (3) or (3A), for at least 3 years immediately preceding his application for the full driving licence to drive a light goods vehicle; and (L.N. 1 of 2020)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: has subsequently passed, within 3 years prior to the date of his application for the full driving licence to drive a light goods vehicle, a driving test in respect of light goods vehicles. (23 of 2008 s. 28)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: Subject to regulations 6, 7, 8 and 9, the Commissioner shall issue a full driving licence to drive a private light bus, private bus, medium goods vehicle, heavy goods vehicle, special purpose vehicle or articulated vehicle to an applicant for such a licence if— (6 of 2012 s. 17; L.N. 1 of 2020)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the applicant—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is the holder of a permanent identity card; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is the holder of an identity card (other than a permanent identity card) and is not subject to any condition of stay other than a limit of stay as defined in section 2(1) of the Immigration Ordinance (Cap. 115); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant has passed, within 3 years prior to the date of his application, a driving test in respect of the class of motor vehicle to which his application relates. (L.N. 3 of 2008)

subsection.name: 1C
subsection.content: The Commissioner may waive the requirement of paragraph (1B)(a) if he considers it appropriate to do so. (L.N. 3 of 2008)

Subject to regulations 6, 7, 8 and 9, the Commissioner shall issue a full driving licence (other than a full driving licence to drive a taxi, public light bus, private light bus, public bus, private bus, medium goods vehicle, heavy goods vehicle, special purpose vehicle or articulated vehicle) to an applicant to drive a motor vehicle of the class to which his application relates if the applicant holds a valid full driving licence for a class of motor vehicle which the Commissioner accepts as evidence of his competence to drive a motor vehicle of the class to which his application relates. (L.N. 3 of 2008 and L.N. 55 of 2008; 23 of 2008 s. 28)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.leadIn: Subject to regulations 6, 7, 8 and 9, the Commissioner shall issue a full driving licence to drive a private light bus, private bus, medium goods vehicle, heavy goods vehicle, special purpose vehicle or articulated vehicle to an applicant for such a licence if— (23 of 2008 s. 28; 6 of 2012 s. 17; L.N. 1 of 2020)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the applicant—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is the holder of a permanent identity card; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is the holder of an identity card (other than a permanent identity card) and is not subject to any condition of stay other than a limit of stay as defined in section 2(1) of the Immigration Ordinance (Cap. 115); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant holds a valid full driving licence for a class of motor vehicle which the Commissioner accepts as evidence of his competence to drive a motor vehicle of the class to which his application relates. (L.N. 3 of 2008 and L.N. 55 of 2008)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.content: The Commissioner may waive the requirement of paragraph (2A)(a) if he considers it appropriate to do so. (L.N. 3 of 2008 and L.N. 55 of 2008)

subsection.name: 2C
subsection.leadIn: Subject to regulations 6, 7, 8, 8A and 9, the Commissioner must issue a full driving licence to drive a taxi, public light bus or public bus to an applicant for such a licence if— (L.N. 1 of 2020)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the applicant—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is the holder of a permanent identity card; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is the holder of an identity card (other than a permanent identity card) and is not subject to any condition of stay other than a limit of stay as defined in section 2(1) of the Immigration Ordinance (Cap. 115); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant satisfies the condition set out in paragraph (2CA)(a), (b) or (c). (L.N. 1 of 2020)

subsection.name: 2CA
subsection.leadIn: The condition is that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the application relates to a taxi, the applicant—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: has passed, within 3 years prior to the date of the application, a driving test in respect of taxis; or

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the application relates to a public light bus, the applicant—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: holds a valid full driving licence to drive a private light bus obtained under paragraph (1B); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: holds a valid full driving licence for a class of motor vehicle which the Commissioner accepts as evidence of the applicant’s competence to drive a public light bus; or

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the application relates to a public bus, the applicant—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: has passed, within 3 years prior to the date of the application, a driving test in respect of public buses and private buses;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: holds a valid full driving licence to drive a private bus obtained under paragraph (1B); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: holds a valid full driving licence for a class of motor vehicle which the Commissioner accepts as evidence of the applicant’s competence to drive a public bus. (L.N. 1 of 2020)

subsection.name: 2D
subsection.content: The Commissioner may waive the requirement of paragraph (2C)(a) if the Commissioner considers it appropriate to do so. (6 of 2012 s. 17)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to paragraph (4) and regulations 6, 7, 8 and 9, the Commissioner may also issue a full driving licence to an applicant if the Commissioner is satisfied that— (23 of 2008 s. 28)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: some time within 3 years before the date on which the applicant makes the application he had held a driver’s certificate or licence issued by a competent authority in any country or place listed in the Fourth Schedule authorizing him to drive motor vehicles of the class which he would be authorized to drive by the licence for which he has applied; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the certificate or licence was originally issued to the applicant after successful completion of a test of competence to drive motor vehicles of the class or description concerned conducted by or on behalf of the competent authority which issued the certificate or licence; and

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the certificate or licence was originally issued to the applicant during a period of residence of not less than 6 months in the country or place of issue; (L.N. 259 of 1984)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the certificate or licence was originally issued to the applicant not less than 5 years immediately prior to the application; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the applicant is the holder of a passport or other equivalent travel document issued in the country or place in which the certificate or licence was issued. (3 of 2002 s. 15)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: Subject to paragraph (4) and regulations 6, 7, 8 and 9, the Commissioner may also issue a full driving licence to an applicant who is a consular officer or consular employee (as defined in the Schedule to the Consular Relations Ordinance (Cap. 557)) if the Commissioner is satisfied— (16 of 2000 s. 15; 23 of 2008 s. 28)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that some time within 3 years before the date on which the applicant makes the application he had held a driver’s certificate or licence issued by a competent authority in the country or place of which he is a consular officer or consular employee authorizing him to drive motor vehicles of the class which he would be authorized to drive by the licence for which he has applied; and (3 of 2002 s. 15)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as regards the requirements of paragraph (3)(b) and (c)(iii). (L.N. 259 of 1984)

subsection.leadIn: No driving licence shall be issued under paragraph (3) or (3A) authorizing any person to drive— (L.N. 3 of 2008)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a public bus or private bus;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a medium goods vehicle;

paragraph.name: c
ca
paragraph.content: an articulated vehicle; or (L.N. 259 of 1984)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a special purpose vehicle.

subsection.name: 5A
subsection.content: The Commissioner may by order published in the Gazette amend the Fourth Schedule. (L.N. 3 of 2008)
A full driving licence to drive any class of motor vehicle may, subject to paragraph (6A), be issued on payment of the fee prescribed in the Second Schedule. (23 of 2008 s. 28)

subsection.name: 6A
subsection.leadIn: No fee shall be payable in respect of a full driving licence— (23 of 2008 s. 28)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: issued to a disabled person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issued to a person to drive a class of motor vehicle if he holds a valid full driving licence to drive another class of motor vehicle. (L.N. 183 of 1997; 23 of 2008 s. 28)

subsection.name: 6B
subsection.leadIn: A full driving licence issued to an applicant to drive a class of motor vehicle shall be valid for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subparagraph (b)—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.leadIn: if, on the date of application, the applicant is over the age of 60 but less than the age of 70—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a period from the date of issue of the licence up to the day before he attains the age of 70; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a period of 3 years from the date of issue of the licence,

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if, on the date of application, the applicant is at or over the age of 70, a period of one year or 3 years from the date of issue of the licence as the applicant chooses; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if, on the date of application, the applicant holds a valid full driving licence to drive another class of motor vehicle, a period that expires at the end of the expiry date of that licence. (23 of 2008 s. 28)

subsection.content: The Commissioner shall specify in a full driving licence the class of motor vehicle, or the type within any class, that the licence holder is authorized to drive.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Application for and issue of learners’ driving licences

subsection.content: A person who wishes to obtain a learner’s driving licence in respect of any class of motor vehicle (other than a motor cycle and a motor tricycle) shall deliver to the Commissioner an application therefor in a form specified by the Commissioner, signed by the applicant, together with his identity document. (L.N. 192 of 1989)

Paragraphs (2) and (3) of regulation 10 shall apply to an applicant for a learner’s driving licence under this regulation to the same extent as those paragraphs apply to an applicant under paragraph (1) of that regulation.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to paragraphs (5) and (6) and regulations 6, 7 and 9, the Commissioner shall on receipt of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application under paragraph (1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to regulation 12E, the fee prescribed in the Second Schedule,

subsection.continued: issue to the applicant a learner’s driving licence to drive the class of motor vehicle the subject of his application. (23 of 2008 s. 29)

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner shall refuse to issue a learner’s driving licence to drive a public light bus or private light bus, a public bus or private bus, a medium goods vehicle, a heavy goods vehicle or a special purpose vehicle unless, on the date of the application for such licence— (L.N. 1 of 2020)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant is a holder of a valid full driving licence to drive a private car or light goods vehicle; and (L.N. 1 of 2020)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: subject to paragraphs (7) and (8)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the licence was issued to the applicant before the relevant date;

subparagraph.name: ii
iii
subparagraph.content: the licence was issued to the applicant pursuant to regulation 11(1AA)(c), (1AB)(c) or (d), (2), (3) or (3A) on or after the relevant date, and the applicant has held the licence for at least 1 year immediately preceding the application. (L.N. 1 of 2020)

subsection.content: The Commissioner shall refuse to issue a learner’s driving licence to drive an articulated vehicle unless, on the date of the application for such licence, the applicant is a holder of a valid full driving licence to drive a medium goods vehicle or heavy goods vehicle. (23 of 2008 s. 29; L.N. 1 of 2020)

The Commissioner may, in relation to a person’s application for a learner’s driving licence under paragraph (1), exempt, in writing, the person from the condition set out in paragraph (5)(b). (23 of 2008 s. 29)
The Commissioner may in his discretion take into consideration driving experience gained other than under a driving licence issued in Hong Kong. (23 of 2008 s. 29)

subsection.leadIn: A learner’s driving licence issued to an applicant to drive a class of motor vehicle shall be valid for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to subparagraph (b), 12 months from the date of issue of the licence; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if, on the date of application, the applicant holds a valid learner’s driving licence to drive another class of motor vehicle, a period that expires at the end of the expiry date of that licence. (23 of 2008 s. 29)

section.name: s12A
section.heading: Learners’ driving licences for motor cycles and motor tricycles

subsection.content: A person who wishes to obtain a learner’s driving licence in respect of a motor cycle or a motor tricycle shall deliver to the Commissioner an application therefor in a form specified by the Commissioner, signed by the applicant, together with his identity document.

Paragraphs (2) and (3) of regulation 10 shall apply to an applicant for a learner’s driving licence under this regulation to the same extent as those paragraphs apply to an applicant under paragraph (1) of that regulation.

On receipt of an application under paragraph (1) and of the fee prescribed in the Second Schedule, the Commissioner shall, subject to paragraphs (4) and (5) and regulations 6, 7 and 9, issue to the applicant a learner’s driving licence in respect of a motor cycle or a motor tricycle, as the case may be, valid for 12 months from the date of issue thereof.

The Commissioner shall refuse to issue a learner’s driving licence in respect of a motor cycle or a motor tricycle unless the applicant has passed, within 2 years prior to the date of his application, Parts A and B of the motor cycle driving test referred to in regulation 12C.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner may refuse to issue a learner’s driving licence in respect of a motor cycle or a motor tricycle if the applicant has, during the 12 months immediately preceding his application, been a holder of such a learner’s driving licence and during that period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has not applied under regulation 12B to take Part C of a motor cycle driving test; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: having so applied to take Part C of a motor cycle driving test, has without reasonable excuse failed to attend for the test on the date and at the time and place notified under regulation 12B.

section.name: s12B
section.heading: Application to take a motor cycle driving test

subsection.leadIn: A person who wishes to submit himself for a motor cycle driving test shall deliver to the Commissioner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: his identity document;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a course certificate issued under Part 9B of the Ordinance; and (E.R. 2 of 2012)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an application therefor in a form specified by the Commissioner, signed by the applicant.

subsection.content: On receipt of an application under paragraph (1) and the payment of the fee prescribed in the Second Schedule, the Commissioner shall issue to the applicant a motor cycle driving test form in a form specified by the Commissioner, and as soon as is practicable thereafter, shall notify the applicant of the date, time and place of the motor cycle driving test. (34 of 1993 s. 5)
No person shall be eligible to take any part of a motor cycle driving test unless he holds a valid motor cycle driving test form issued under paragraph (2).

subsection.leadIn: A motor cycle driving test form issued under paragraph (2) shall cease to be valid—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the holder thereof fails to attend for a motor cycle driving test on the date and at the time and place notified under paragraph (2) unless—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the holder has given not less than 7 days’ notice to the Commissioner of his inability to attend for such test; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the Commissioner is satisfied that the holder was through circumstances beyond his control unable to attend for such test; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on the expiration of 18 months after the date on which it was issued.

subsection.content: If a motor cycle driving test form issued under paragraph (2) continues to be valid by virtue of paragraph (4)(a)(i) or (ii), the Commissioner shall give reasonable notice to the holder thereof of the date, time and place of a further motor cycle driving test and, if the holder thereof fails to attend for such further test, paragraph (4) shall apply as if the date, time and place of the test had been notified under paragraph (2).

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner may refund the fee paid to him under paragraph (2) and cancel the motor cycle driving test form issued under that paragraph if he is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the holder thereof is either ineligible to obtain, or is disqualified from obtaining or holding, a driving licence; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the holder thereof has been unable to attend for the motor cycle driving test owing to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the test having been cancelled at short notice by the Commissioner; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: other circumstances beyond the control of the holder thereof.

section.name: s12C
section.heading: Conduct of motor cycle driving test

subsection.content: A motor cycle driving test shall be divided into 3 parts, and, subject to paragraph (3), no part of a test shall be taken until the applicant for the test has passed any preceding part.
Each part of a motor cycle driving test shall comprise the requirements relevant to that part specified in the Eleventh Schedule.
The Commissioner may exempt an applicant from any part of a motor cycle driving test where he considers the applicant’s previous experience is adequate in that part.

If an applicant tested by an authorized examiner fails any part of the motor cycle driving test, the Commissioner may refuse to permit him to undergo a further test until a day to be fixed by the Commissioner which shall not be less than 30 days from the day of the previous test.

A person who wishes to undergo Part B or C of a motor cycle driving test shall provide at his own expense for the test a motor cycle or a motor tricycle (as the case may be), and an authorized examiner may refuse to conduct a test where he has reason to suspect that the motor cycle or the motor tricycle so provided is not suitable for the purpose or is not in a good mechanical condition.

While a motor cycle driving test is being conducted the motor cycle or the motor tricycle used for the purpose of the test shall have a “Driver on Test” plate specified by the Commissioner displayed at the front and rear of the motor cycle or motor tricycle.

section.name: s12D
section.heading: Passing of motor cycle driving test
section.content: A person shall pass a motor cycle driving test if he satisfies an authorized examiner conducting the test that he is able to comply with all the relevant requirements specified in the Eleventh Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to regulation 20, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Commissioner cancels under regulation 12L(1) a full driving licence issued to a person to drive a private car or light goods vehicle; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Commissioner has previously issued to the person, as a holder of the full driving licence to drive a private car or light goods vehicle, as the case may be, pursuant to regulation 12(5) a learner’s driving licence to drive a public light bus or private light bus, a public bus or private bus, a medium goods vehicle, a heavy goods vehicle or a special purpose vehicle,

subsection.continued: the Commissioner shall also cancel that learner’s driving licence.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to regulation 20, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Commissioner cancels under regulation 12L(1B) a full driving licence issued to a person to drive a medium goods vehicle or heavy goods vehicle; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Commissioner has previously issued to the person, as a holder of the full driving licence to drive a medium goods vehicle or heavy goods vehicle, as the case may be, pursuant to regulation 12(6) a learner’s driving licence to drive an articulated vehicle,

subsection.continued: the Commissioner shall also cancel that learner’s driving licence.

subsection.content: If a full driving licence is cancelled under regulation 12L which causes the cancellation of a learner’s driving licence under this regulation, such cancellation of the learner’s driving licence shall not take effect until the cancellation under regulation 12L takes effect.

On cancellation of a learner’s driving licence under this regulation, the Commissioner shall give to the licence holder notice of such cancellation, and the licence holder shall, within 72 hours after receipt of the notice, surrender the learner’s driving licence to the Commissioner.

section.name: s12E
section.heading: No fee payable in respect of certain learners’ driving licences
section.leadIn: No fee shall be payable in respect of a learner’s driving licence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: issued to a disabled person to drive a private car, motor cycle or motor tricycle;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to drive a Government vehicle; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: issued to a person to drive a class of motor vehicle if he holds a valid learner’s driving licence to drive another class of motor vehicle. (23 of 2008 s. 31)

subsection.leadIn: A probationary driving period for the purpose of a person’s application for a full driving licence to drive a class of motor vehicle—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: commences on the date on which the probationary driving licence to drive the class of motor vehicle is issued to the person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (3), lasts for a period of such length as specified in paragraph (2).

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of paragraph (1)(b), the period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is 12 months; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: is to be extended by 6 months if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the person is convicted of one offence mentioned in the Twelfth Schedule; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: the offence was committed by him during those 12 months while driving—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: subject to sub-sub-subparagraph (B), a relevant motor vehicle; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: in the case of a probationary driving licence to drive a motor cycle or motor tricycle that was issued to him before the relevant date, a motor cycle or motor tricycle.

subsection.leadIn: In calculating the length of the period, the following is excluded—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a period during which the person does not hold a valid probationary driving licence to drive the class of motor vehicle;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person’s probationary driving licence to drive the class of motor vehicle is cancelled under regulation 12I, a period commencing on the issue of the licence and ending on the cancellation of it.

section.name: s12G
section.heading: Application for and issue of probationary driving licences

subsection.content: A person who wishes to apply for a probationary driving licence to drive a motor cycle, motor tricycle, private car or light goods vehicle shall apply to the Commissioner in a form specified by the Commissioner, signed by the applicant, together with his identity document and the fee prescribed in the Second Schedule. (23 of 2008 s. 33)
Regulation 10(2) and (3) shall apply to an applicant referred to in paragraph (1) to the same extent as regulation 10(2) and (3) applies to an applicant referred to in regulation 10(1).

subsection.leadIn: Subject to paragraph (4) and regulations 6, 7 and 9, the Commissioner shall on receipt of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application under paragraph (1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to regulation 12J(a) or (b), the fee prescribed in the Second Schedule,

subsection.continued: issue to the applicant a probationary driving licence to drive the class of motor vehicle the subject of his application. (23 of 2008 s. 33)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: On issuing a probationary driving licence to a person under paragraph (3) to drive a class of motor vehicle, the Commissioner may, subject to regulation 12J(c), if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the fact that the person has passed the relevant driving test is accepted by the Commissioner as evidence of the person’s competence to drive a motor vehicle of another class; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person does not hold a probationary, temporary or full driving licence to drive that other class of motor vehicle,

subsection.continued: at the same time issue to the person a probationary driving licence to drive that other class of motor vehicle. (23 of 2008 s. 33)

subsection.name: 3B
subsection.leadIn: A probationary driving licence issued to an applicant to drive a class of motor vehicle shall be valid for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to subparagraph (b), 12 months from the date of issue of the licence; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if, on the date of application, the applicant holds a valid probationary driving licence to drive another class of motor vehicle, a period that expires at the end of the expiry date of that licence. (23 of 2008 s. 33)

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner shall refuse to issue a probationary driving licence to drive a class of motor vehicle unless the applicant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has passed, within 3 years prior to the date of his application, the relevant driving test; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has not previously been issued with a probationary driving licence to drive the class of motor vehicle after passing that relevant driving test. (23 of 2008 s. 33)

def.name: RelevantDrivingTest
def.leadIn: In this regulation, relevant driving test (有關駕駛測驗)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a probationary driving licence to drive a motor cycle or motor tricycle, means a motor cycle driving test;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a probationary driving licence to drive a private car or light goods vehicle, means a driving test in respect of private cars or light goods vehicles, as the case may be. (23 of 2008 s. 33)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to paragraph (3) and regulations 6 and 9, the Commissioner shall renew a probationary driving licence for 6 months on receipt of an application for such renewal in a form specified by the Commissioner, signed by the applicant, together with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: his identity document; and (L.N. 49 of 2007)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the fee prescribed in the Second Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: A probationary driving licence may be renewed at any time within—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 15 days before its expiry, such renewal to be effective from the date of expiry; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 3 years after its expiry, such renewal to be effective from the date of renewal.

subsection.content: Regulation 10(3) shall apply to an applicant referred to in paragraph (1) to the same extent as regulation 10(3) applies to an applicant referred to in regulation 10(1).

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to regulation 20, the Commissioner shall cancel a probationary driving licence to drive a class of motor vehicle if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the licence holder—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: has more than once been convicted of an offence mentioned in the Twelfth Schedule;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has been convicted of 2 or more offences mentioned in the Twelfth Schedule; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: is convicted of an offence in respect of which 10 or more points shall be incurred under section 4 of the Road Traffic (Driving-offence Points) Ordinance (Cap. 375); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the offence was committed, during the probationary driving period for the purpose of the application for a full driving licence to drive the class of motor vehicle, by the licence holder while driving—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: subject to sub-subparagraph (ii), a relevant motor vehicle; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of a probationary driving licence to drive a motor cycle or motor tricycle that was issued to him before the relevant date, a motor cycle or motor tricycle. (23 of 2008 s. 34)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: On cancellation of a probationary driving licence under paragraph (1), the Commissioner shall give to the licence holder notice of such cancellation, and the licence holder shall, within 72 hours after receipt of the notice, surrender the probationary driving licence to the Commissioner. (23 of 2008 s. 34)

If an appeal is lodged against a conviction referred to in paragraph (1) which causes the cancellation of a probationary driving licence under this regulation, such cancellation shall not take effect until the appeal is withdrawn or dismissed.

section.name: s12J
section.heading: No fee payable in respect of certain probationary driving licences
section.leadIn: No fee shall be payable in respect of a probationary driving licence— (23 of 2008 s. 35)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: issued or reissued to or renewed for a disabled person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issued or reissued to a person to drive a class of motor vehicle if he holds a valid probationary driving licence to drive another class of motor vehicle;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: issued under regulation 12G(3A); or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: reissued under regulation 12M(3).

subsection.leadIn: The holder of a probationary driving licence shall not drive a motor vehicle of a class specified in the licence unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a probationary driving licence to drive a private car or light goods vehicle, the motor vehicle has—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a Small Plate securely fixed at the front of the motor vehicle, or on the left-hand side of the front windscreen of the motor vehicle, in such a manner that the Plate is clearly visible from the front of the motor vehicle; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a Small Plate securely fixed at the rear of the motor vehicle, or on the left-hand side of the rear windscreen of the motor vehicle, in such a manner that the Plate is clearly visible from the rear of the motor vehicle;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a probationary driving licence to drive a motor cycle or motor tricycle that is issued on or after the relevant date, the motor vehicle has a Small Plate securely fixed at the front and rear of the motor vehicle; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a probationary driving licence to drive a motor cycle or motor tricycle that was issued before the relevant date or is reissued or renewed within 12 months from the relevant date, the motor vehicle has—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a Large Plate securely fixed at the front and rear of the motor vehicle; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a Small Plate securely fixed at the front and rear of the motor vehicle.

subsection.content: The holder of a probationary driving licence to drive a motor cycle or motor tricycle shall not drive the motor cycle or motor tricycle with any passenger on it.

subsection.leadIn: In this regulation—

def.name: LargePlate
def.leadIn: Large Plate (大字牌) means a white plate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the size of which is 225 mm by 150 mm;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on which the letter “P”, appearing in red, occupies an area stated in the diagram in Part II of the Thirteenth Schedule; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: which is made of reflex-reflecting material;

def.name: SmallPlate
def.leadIn: Small Plate (小字牌) means a white plate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the size of which is 150 mm by 150 mm;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on which the letter “P”, appearing in red, occupies an area stated in the diagram in Part I of the Thirteenth Schedule; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: which is made of reflex-reflecting material.

section.name: s12L
section.heading: Cancellation of full driving licences issued to holders of probationary driving licences, etc.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to regulation 20, the Commissioner shall cancel a full driving licence to drive a motor cycle, motor tricycle, private car or light goods vehicle if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the licence holder is, after the probationary driving period for the purpose of the application for the full driving licence, convicted of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an offence mentioned in the Twelfth Schedule; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an offence in respect of which 10 or more points shall be incurred under section 4 of the Road Traffic (Driving-offence Points) Ordinance (Cap. 375); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the offence was committed, during that probationary driving period, by the licence holder while driving—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: subject to sub-subparagraph (ii), a relevant motor vehicle; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of a probationary driving licence to drive a motor cycle or motor tricycle that was issued to him before the relevant date, a motor cycle or motor tricycle. (23 of 2008 s. 37)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to regulation 20, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Commissioner cancels under paragraph (1) a full driving licence issued to a person to drive a private car; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Commissioner has previously issued to the person pursuant to regulation 11(1AB)(d) a full driving licence to drive a light goods vehicle as a holder of the full driving licence to drive a private car,

subsection.continued: the Commissioner shall also cancel the full driving licence to drive a light goods vehicle. (23 of 2008 s. 37)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to regulation 20, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Commissioner cancels under paragraph (1) a full driving licence issued to a person to drive a private car or light goods vehicle; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Commissioner has previously issued to the person pursuant to regulation 11(1B) or (2C) a full driving licence to drive a motor vehicle of another class for which the person is eligible under regulation 8(1) as a holder of the full driving licence to drive a private car or light goods vehicle, as the case may be, (L.N. 1 of 2020)

subsection.continued: the Commissioner shall also cancel the full driving licence to drive a motor vehicle of that other class. (23 of 2008 s. 37)

subsection.name: 1C
subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to regulation 20, if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the Commissioner has previously issued to the person pursuant to regulation 11(1B) a full driving licence to drive an articulated vehicle for which the person is eligible under regulation 8(2) as a holder of the full driving licence to drive a medium goods vehicle or heavy goods vehicle, as the case may be,

subsection.continued: the Commissioner shall also cancel the full driving licence to drive an articulated vehicle. (23 of 2008 s. 37)

subsection.name: 1D
subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to regulation 20, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Commissioner cancels under paragraph (1), (1B) or (1C) a full driving licence issued to a person to drive a motor vehicle of a class; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the Commissioner has previously—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: accepted the full driving licence as evidence of the person’s competence to drive a motor vehicle of another class; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: issued to the person pursuant to regulation 11(2), (2A) or (2C) a full driving licence to drive a motor vehicle of that other class, (L.N. 1 of 2020)

subsection.continued: the Commissioner shall also cancel the full driving licence to drive a motor vehicle of that other class. (23 of 2008 s. 37)

subsection.name: 1E
subsection.content: On cancellation of a full driving licence under this regulation, the Commissioner shall give to the licence holder notice of such cancellation, and the licence holder shall, within 72 hours after receipt of the notice, surrender the full driving licence to the Commissioner. (23 of 2008 s. 37)

If an appeal is lodged against a conviction referred to in paragraph (1) which causes the cancellation of a full driving licence under this regulation, such cancellation shall not take effect until the appeal is withdrawn or dismissed.

If a full driving licence is cancelled under paragraph (1) which causes the cancellation of another full driving licence under this regulation, such cancellation of that other full driving licence shall not take effect until the cancellation under that paragraph takes effect. (23 of 2008 s. 37)

If a person’s full driving licence to drive a class of motor vehicle is cancelled under regulation 12L(1) because the person is convicted of one offence mentioned in the Twelfth Schedule, the person may, for the purpose of regulation 12F(2)(b), within 3 years after the cancellation, apply to the Commissioner in a form specified by the Commissioner for the reissue to him of the probationary driving licence to drive the class of motor vehicle that was held by him before the issue of the full driving licence.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to regulations 6 and 9, the Commissioner shall, for the purpose of regulation 12F(2)(b), on receipt of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application under paragraph (1) signed by the applicant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant’s identity document; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: subject to regulation 12J(a) or (b), the fee prescribed in the Second Schedule,

subsection.continued: reissue to the applicant the probationary driving licence to drive the class of motor vehicle the subject of his application.

subsection.leadIn: On reissuing a probationary driving licence to a person under paragraph (2) to drive the class of motor vehicle the subject of his application under paragraph (1), the Commissioner may, subject to regulation 12J(d), at the same time reissue to the person the probationary driving licence to drive a motor vehicle of another class, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the probationary driving licence to drive that other class of motor vehicle—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: was issued to him under regulation 12G(3A) on issuing the probationary driving licence to drive the class of motor vehicle the subject of his application; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: was held by him before the issue of the full driving licence to drive that other class of motor vehicle which was cancelled under regulation 12L(1) because he is convicted of one offence mentioned in the Twelfth Schedule; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he does not hold a probationary, temporary or full driving licence to drive that other class of motor vehicle.

subsection.leadIn: A probationary driving licence reissued under this regulation to an applicant to drive a class of motor vehicle shall be valid for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to subparagraph (b), 6 months from the date of reissue of the licence; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if, on the date of application, the applicant holds a valid probationary driving licence to drive another class of motor vehicle, a period that expires at the end of the expiry date of that licence.

subsection.content: If a probationary driving licence is reissued under this regulation, the licence shall, for the purposes of these regulations, be treated as a licence renewed under regulation 12H.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Application for and issue of temporary driving licences

subsection.leadIn: Any person, other than a consular officer or consular employee to whom regulation 11(3A) applies, arriving in Hong Kong to take up residence who— (L.N. 259 of 1984)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is the holder of a valid driver’s certificate or licence issued outside Hong Kong by a competent authority in any country or place not listed in the Fourth Schedule; and (3 of 2002 s. 15)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: within 3 months after the date of his arrival in Hong Kong, makes an application under regulation 31 for a driving test,

subsection.continued: may apply to the Commissioner for a temporary driving licence.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to paragraph (3), the Commissioner may issue a temporary driving licence to an applicant under paragraph (1) if the Commissioner is satisfied that— (L.N. 259 of 1984)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the driver’s certificate or licence held by the applicant was originally issued to him during a period of residence of not less than 6 months in the country or place of issue; (L.N. 259 of 1984)

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: the applicant is the holder of a passport or other equivalent travel document issued in the country or place in which the driver’s certificate or licence held by him was issued. (3 of 2002 s. 15)

subsection.leadIn: No temporary driving licence shall be issued under this regulation authorizing any person to drive—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a public bus or private bus;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a medium goods vehicle;

paragraph.name: c
ca
paragraph.content: an articulated vehicle; or (L.N. 259 of 1984)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a special purpose vehicle.

subsection.leadIn: An applicant under paragraph (1) shall deliver to the Commissioner an application in a form specified by the Commissioner, signed by the applicant, together with—

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: his identity document; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: his driver’s certificate or licence referred to in paragraph (1)(a).

subsection.content: On receipt of an application under paragraph (4) and of the fee prescribed in the Second Schedule, the Commissioner may, subject to paragraphs (2) and (3) and regulations 6, 7 and 9, issue to the applicant a temporary driving licence in respect of a vehicle of a class which the applicant is authorized by his driver’s certificate or licence to drive, valid until the expiry of his driver’s certificate or licence or the expiry of 12 months from the date of his arrival in Hong Kong, whichever occurs first.
The Commissioner may in his discretion extend the validity of a temporary driving licence for one further period not exceeding 6 months subject to such conditions as he thinks fit.
The Commissioner shall specify in a temporary driving licence the class of motor vehicle, or the type within any class, that the licence holder is authorized to drive.

If during the validity of a temporary driving licence the licence holder fails to pass a driving test, the Commissioner shall cancel his temporary driving licence from the time which the licence holder is informed that he has so failed.

On cancellation of a temporary driving licence, the Commissioner shall give to the licence holder notice of such cancellation, and the licence holder shall, within 72 hours after receipt of such notice, surrender his temporary driving licence to the Commissioner.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Application for and issue of driving licences for Government vehicles

subsection.leadIn: A person who wishes to obtain a driving licence to drive Government vehicles shall deliver to the Commissioner an application therefor in a form specified by the Commissioner, signed by the applicant, together with—

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: his identity document; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a valid Government driving permit, or other evidence to the satisfaction of the Commissioner, specifying the class of Government vehicle that he is competent to drive.

subsection.content: On receipt of an application under paragraph (1), the Commissioner shall, subject to regulations 6 and 9, issue a driving licence to the applicant authorizing him to drive Government vehicles of the class specified in the licence.

Where an applicant for a driving licence to drive Government vehicles is the holder of a valid full driving licence in respect of any class of vehicle other than Government vehicles, he shall lodge that licence with the Commissioner at the time of his application under paragraph (1); and where the Commissioner subsequently issues to the applicant a driving licence to drive Government vehicles, he shall endorse it with an endorsement authorizing the licence holder to drive, in addition to Government vehicles, the class of vehicle which the full driving licence authorized the licence holder to drive.
A driving licence issued under paragraph (2) shall be valid for 10 years from the date of issue. (L.N. 183 of 1997)
No fee shall be payable for the issue of a driving licence under this regulation.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to paragraphs (2), (6), (7) and (9) and regulations 6 and 9, the Commissioner shall renew a full driving licence on receipt of an application made in such form and in such manner as is specified by the Commissioner, together with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant’s document of identity as defined in regulation 10(4); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the fee prescribed in the Second Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: No driving licence authorizing a person to drive a taxi, public light bus, private light bus, public bus, private bus, medium goods vehicle, heavy goods vehicle, special purpose vehicle or articulated vehicle shall be renewed under paragraph (1) unless the applicant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is the holder of a permanent identity card; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is the holder of an identity card (other than a permanent identity card) and is not subject to any condition of stay other than a limit of stay as defined in section 2(1) of the Immigration Ordinance (Cap. 115).

subsection.leadIn: Where the application is for the renewal of a full driving licence (other than a full driving licence to drive a taxi, public light bus, private light bus, public bus, private bus, medium goods vehicle, heavy goods vehicle, special purpose vehicle or articulated vehicle), the Commissioner may waive the requirement of paragraph (1)(a) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the application is made in a form specified by the Commissioner that contains a unique password assigned to the applicant by the Commissioner; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the application is made electronically by means of an online communication system using a template specified by the Commissioner and—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the applicant identifies himself by the unique password assigned to him by the Commissioner; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the applicant provides the information required by the Commissioner as set out in the template.

subsection.leadIn: Where the application is for the renewal of a full driving licence to drive a taxi, public light bus, private light bus, public bus, private bus, medium goods vehicle, heavy goods vehicle, special purpose vehicle or articulated vehicle, the Commissioner may waive the requirement of paragraph (1)(a) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the application is made in the manner referred to in either paragraph (3)(a) or (b); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the applicant makes a declaration in a manner specified in the form or template (as the case may be) that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: he is the holder of a permanent identity card; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: he is the holder of an identity card (other than a permanent identity card) and is not subject to any condition of stay other than a limit of stay as defined in section 2(1) of the Immigration Ordinance (Cap. 115).

subsection.content: The Commissioner may waive the requirement of paragraph (2) if he considers it appropriate to do so.

subsection.leadIn: A full driving licence may be renewed at any time—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: during the period of 4 months before the date of its expiry, such renewal to be effective from the date of expiry;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: within 15 days after the date of its expiry, such renewal to be effective from the date of expiry;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: during the period exceeding 15 days but not exceeding 3 years after the date of its expiry, such renewal to be effective from the date of renewal.
